data.text: My son, defraud not the poor of his living,
Make not a hungry soul sorrowful;
Add not more trouble to a heart that is vexed;
Reject not the supplication of the afflicted;
Turn not away thine eye from the needy,
For if he curse thee in the bitterness of his soul,
Get thyself the love of the congregation,
Let it not grieve thee to bow down thine ear to the poor,
Deliver him that suffereth wrong from the hand of the oppressor;
Be as a father unto the fatherless,
Wisdom exalteth her children,
He that loveth her loveth life;
He that holdeth her fast shall inherit glory;
They that serve her shall minister to the Holy One:
Whoso giveth ear unto her shall judge the nations:
If a man commit himself unto her, he shall inherit her;
For at the first she will walk with him by crooked ways,
Then will she return the straight way unto him,
But if he go wrong, she will forsake him,
Observe the opportunity, and beware of evil;
For there is a shame that bringeth sin;
Accept no person against thy soul,
And refrain not to speak, when there is occasion to do good,
For by speech wisdom shall be known:
In no wise speak against the truth;
Be not ashamed to confess thy sins;
Make not thyself an underling to a foolish man;
Strive for the truth unto death,
Be not hasty in thy tongue,
Be not as a lion in thy house,
Let not thine hand be stretched out to receive,
